intro: Cayratia acris, commonly known as the creeping cayratia, is a climbing vine native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its fruits are small, round berries that turn red when mature, often containing several seeds. Cayratia acris is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
